questions.q: A specific IP address is 32 bits long and consists of four bytes. What is the maximum decimal value each of these four bytes can represent?
questions.explanation: According to the sources, an IP address is 32 bits (4 bytes) long [1]. Each of the 4 bytes is represented by a number ranging from 0 to 255, separated by dots [1].

questions.q: In the context of E-mail protocols, which specific protocol is used for 'Sending' rather than 'Receiving' messages?
questions.explanation: The sources specify that SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is used for sending e-mail [2]. Conversely, POP (POP3) and IMAP are protocols used for receiving e-mail [2].

questions.q: According to the HTML version history provided, in what year was HTML5 officially introduced?
questions.explanation: The sources provide a table of HTML versions showing that HTML5 was introduced in 2014 [3]. This followed XHTML in 2000 and HTML 4.01 in 1999 [3].

questions.q: If a developer needs to convert a 14px font size to 'em' units based on the standard default browser size, what is the correct value?
questions.explanation: The default font size is 16px, where 1em equals 16px [4]. To convert from pixels to em, the sources provide the formula: em = px / 16 [5]. Therefore, 14 / 16 equals 0.875em [5].

questions.q: In the CSS Box Model, which of the following properties is NOT inherited by child elements from their parents?
questions.explanation: Child elements inherit properties like color, font-size, and text-align from their parents [6]. However, the sources explicitly state that padding, margin, borders, and background-color are not inherited [6].

questions.q: When configuring an HTML Table, what is the functional difference between 'cellspacing' and 'cellpadding'?
options: Cellspacing is for border color; cellpadding is for background color.
Cellspacing defines space between cells; cellpadding defines space between the cell border and its content.
Cellspacing defines internal content width; cellpadding defines external row height.
There is no difference; they are used interchangeably.
questions.explanation: The sources define cellspacing as the attribute that defines space between table cells [7, 8]. Cellpadding represents the distance between cell borders and the actual content within that cell [7, 8].

questions.q: Which CSS selector should be used if you want to style ONLY the direct children of a specific element, rather than all descendants?
questions.explanation: The sources explain that child selectors use the '>' symbol to select direct children only [9]. Standard descendant selectors (like 'ul li') select all elements nested within, regardless of depth [9, 10].

questions.q: What is the correct priority order for CSS cascading, from the MOST powerful to the LEAST powerful?
options: Inline style > Internal style sheet > External style sheet > Browser default
Browser default > External style sheet > Internal style sheet > Inline style
External style sheet > Internal style sheet > Inline style > Browser default
Inline style > Browser default > External style sheet > Internal style sheet
questions.explanation: The cascading order priority starts with Inline styles as the most powerful [11]. This is followed by internal style sheets, then external style sheets, and finally the browser default as the least powerful [11].

questions.q: Regarding HTML Form methods, why is 'POST' preferred over 'GET' for sensitive data like passwords?
options: POST is faster than GET for small data.
GET appends data to the URL making it visible, while POST appends it inside the HTTP request body.
POST allows for bookmarks while GET does not.
GET has no size limitations, making it too risky for passwords.
questions.explanation: The sources warn never to use GET for sensitive data because it appends data to the URL, making it visible to users [12]. POST is safer for personal information because it appends data inside the body of the HTTP request and does not show it in the URL [12, 13].

questions.q: A 'Full Stack' developer must be capable of programming which three components of a website?
questions.explanation: A full stack web developer can develop both client and server software [14]. This includes programming the browser (JavaScript), the server (PHP, Python, etc.), and the database (SQL, MongoDB) [14].

questions.q: In an Ordered List (<ol>), which attribute is used to change the starting number of the list items?
questions.explanation: The sources state that the 'start' attribute for the <ol> tag is used to specify the starting point of numbering [15]. The 'type' attribute is used to change the numbering scheme, such as Roman numerals or letters [16].

questions.q: What is the calculated total width of an element with: width: 300px; padding: 10px; border: 5px solid; and margin: 20px?
questions.explanation: According to the box model formula, Total element width = width + left/right padding + left/right border + left/right margin [17]. Here: 300 + (10*2) + (5*2) + (20*2) = 300 + 20 + 10 + 40 = 370px [17, 18].

questions.q: Which specific HTML tag is used to define a term within a Description List (<dl>)?
questions.explanation: A description list uses the <dl> tag to define the list, the <dt> tag to define the term (name), and the <dd> tag to describe that term [19, 20].

questions.q: Which of the following is a primary disadvantage of using Inline Styles?
options: They are too powerful and override all other styles.
They increase download times by enlarging the HTML document.
They cannot be used with colors or fonts.
questions.explanation: Inline styles should be avoided because they clog up HTML documents, making them larger and increasing download times [21]. This separates them from external styles which save work by controlling multiple documents from one file [22, 23].

questions.q: What does the 'DNS' (Domain Name System) do when a user enters a URL like 'google.com' into a browser?
options: It creates a new IP address for the user.
It translates the domain name into its corresponding IP address automatically.
It stores the website's HTML files locally.
questions.explanation: The Domain Name System (DNS) associates Domain Names with IP addresses [24]. It acts as a translator, converting the domain name into the IP address automatically for the browser [24].
